item.title: As we celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ, let us remember he...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

As we celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ, let us remember he was homeless and undocumented.

So I expect everyone, especially those on the right side of the aisle to treat our neighbors like they would treat Jesus.

Merry Christmas
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Enjoy the next few minutes of my colleagues Jennifer Bacon and...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Enjoy the next few minutes of my colleagues Jennifer Bacon and Scott Baldermann close out our final board meeting of 2020 with some HEAT!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today our community has lost a true champion for justice. Mrs....
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today our community has lost a true champion for justice.

Mrs. Earleen Brown was an advocate for education in the Denver community and was my number one supporter. In 2017 she rode around Denver in what we called the “Tay-mobile.”

She stood with me again as I sought the At-Large seat in 2020, but she was more than a supporter she was an additional grandma. She would randomly call and check in on me, she would always hold my feet to the fire to ensure I was serving my commun...ity, and she would be the first one to help pick me up when life would knock me down.

Mrs. Earleen will be forever missed and I am committing to fight so her legacy is remembered in Denver Public Schools.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Yesterday outgoing DPS Superintendent Susana Cordova sat down...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Yesterday outgoing DPS Superintendent Susana Cordova sat down with Anne Trujillo and said that she never felt mistreated nor was she in a hostile work environment.

I am now calling on Mayor Hancock, Mayor Peña, and the 14 former SB Directors to retract their statements.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I would like to wish all of our families that celebrate Hanukkah...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I would like to wish all of our families that celebrate Hanukkah a very Happy Hanukkah.

I'm excited to celebrate our diverse faiths and backgrounds and to show our students that we as a community value each and every one of them.

UPDATE REGARDING QUARTERLY SYSTEM IN DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS!

This decision has now been moved to a school based decision, the School Board is not weighing in on this issue as it is a individual school by school management decision.

item.title: Denver School Board Director - Tay AndersonScott Baldermann, Denver Public Schools Board of Education - District 1Several parents and...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay AndersonScott Baldermann, Denver Public Schools Board of Education - District 1

Several parents and guardians have asked about summer school or an extended school year. Below is a message Superintendent Cordova said I could share.

DPS is co...mmitted to ensuring that students have the support they need to address unfinished learning. We are looking at supports and changes to the in class instruction, adding tutoring and offering summer programming to extend the school year. The last two concepts require additional funding and we are pursuing philanthropic support as well as federal funding to accomplish this.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: At Large and In Charge: I have been raised in a family of...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

At Large and In Charge:

I have been raised in a family of educators. Coming from those who are black women, who have had 50 years in the game of education; a lot of them were the first in their profession in Kansas City. That is where I am originally from. They broke a lot of barriers for me to be here today, so now I am running with the torch that they gave to me when they retired.

"OUT FRONT" had the opportunity to chat with Denver Public Schools Board of Education member, community organizer, and activist Tay Anderson.

outfrontmagazine.com

At Large and In Charge: Tay Anderson - OUT FRONT

"OUT FRONT" had the opportunity to chat with Denver Public Schools Board of Education member, community organizer, and activist Tay Anderson."OUT FRONT" had the opportunity to chat with Denver Public Schools Board of Education member, community organizer, and activist Tay Anderson.

item.title: Over the past few weeks, we've been working with our health...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Over the past few weeks, we've been working with our health partners and middle & high school leaders on efforts to have all secondary students return to in-person learning as soon as we can do so following the guidance from Denver Health.

Denver Public Schools

Over the past few weeks, we've been working with our health partners and middle & high school leaders on efforts to have all secondary students return to in-person learning as soon as we can do so following the guidance from Denver Health.
View timeline ➡️ bit.ly/3nbamfG
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways — I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences — I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
